then only way I know of fixing that if you can't properly install it is manually removing it from the status file.

usually it's safe if you backup first though

well open a terminal. then cd /var/lib/dpkg. the sudo cp status status.backup to backup the status file

you backed up the status file? ls confirms it?

ok. sudo nano status. then you'll see that each package has a section of about 20 lines and each section is seperated by a blank line. locate the section for you package and remove that section and save the file
then apt will think it was never installed

if apt then works ok, good. if not restore the old status file and try something else
it varies. some 20 lines usually. you can tell by the blank lines
